The audience ranges in age from about 30 to 50 years or anyone who likes ‘Classic Hits from the 60’s to today’. The iwi radio format is packed with local news, interactive talkback and Waiata in Te Reo Māori. The station promotes the use of Te Reo Māori as a means of everyday communication, and whilst targeted at native speakers, listening to the station is a great way to improve Te Reo Māori for beginners, and second language learners. How do you get involved? Te Hiku FM is always keen to hear your views and encourages listeners to contribute to topical discussion. If you have a panui to share with the iwi or a kaupapa that you would like to talk about then please contact Maria Tauroa.
